bibl.title: Law and Social Formation in the Roman Empire.
bibl.note: Introduction. - Patria potestas and the economy. - Legal definitions of status. - Law and honor. - Citizenship. - Honestiores and humiliores. - Access to legal protections. - Self-help and its limitations. - Written documents. - Conclusion. - Uses papyrological evidence.

bibl.title: The Oxford Handbook of Social Relations in the Roman World.

bibl.seg: Kehoe Dennis P., Law and Social Formation in the Roman Empire.
Michael Peachin (Ed.), The Oxford Handbook of Social Relations in the Roman World (Oxford, 2011) pp. 144-163.

Introduction. - Patria potestas and the economy. - Legal definitions of status. - Law and honor. - Citizenship. - Honestiores and humiliores. - Access to legal protections. - Self-help and its limitations. - Written documents. - Conclusion. - Uses papyrological evidence.
